Backup

Simple, Reliable, and Economical Integrated Cloud Backup.

Apply for trial Purchase now

Azure Backup is a reliable, low-cost, and expandable solution, allowing for backup of local data onto the cloud. Without any capital investment, you can protect your key business data with the lowest operating expenses.

From now on, Azure Backup enables backup of VM on Azure through a few simple steps, and also permits placing the restore points on the cloud storage. Whenever necessary, you can respond from the restore points to meet various demands for protecting Azure virtual machines.

Pricing Details

Backup service is charged by the size of every protected instance, at an increment of 500 GB. In addition, Azure storage space is charged individually, allowing for reduction in long-lasting storage cost. Customers can make a flexible selection between LRS or GRS Block Blob storage (please refer to the pricing details of Block Blob of General-purpose Storage Accounts).

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly price estimation is based on a usage of 744 hours every month.

FAQs

Expand All

Overview

  • Which content is being charged against me in the new pricing model?

    The new pricing includes two parts:

    • The used Azure Block Blob storage capacity: used for storing backup data and restore points. The storage redundancy options are also flexible. For the backup vault, customers can make a selection between LRS and GRS.
    • Price of Azure Backup software for protected instance.

    This content will be listed on your Azure monthly bills as individual line items.

  • Why did you modify the pricing model?

    When maintaining data for a short period of time, the model for charging customers for the stored backup data for every GB is valid. With continued improvements in long-term retention functions in Azure Backup, as well as continuous increases in pending backup data, the GB charging model brings high costs for customers that need to maintain data for a long period of time. The new business model enables customers to utilize the scale benefits brought by Azure storage space while continuously enjoying the enhanced functions of Azure Backup.

  • Do I have to pay for restoration and Internet exports?

    We will not charge customers for any restore and/or outgoing network bandwidth (exports) relating to restore.

  • How much can I expect to save on costs?

    The main driving factor for this modification is allowing customers to get huge value by using Azure Backup. Compared with the GB charging model, customers can save costs by up to 52% when using LRS Block Blob Storage and the new pricing.

Protected Servers and Instances

  • What are protected instances?

    Protected instances refer to the billing units used in Azure Backup, and the software overhead is charged according to the size of the protected computers (also called “size of front-end”). Thus, the bigger protected instances mean more expenses charged to customers. For instance, if a document server with a volume of 2200 GB is protected in Azure Backup, customers are charged ¥316.45/month (2200 GB/500 GB = 4.4, rounded to 5 in increments of 500 GB , ¥63.29/increment).

  • Which types of protected instances are included?

    There are three types:

    • Virtual machines: can be Hyper-V virtual machines
    • Windows or Linux server computers: can be physical host computers or virtual guests. These computers generally have some applications requiring backup or some running workloads. The common workloads include: Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics as well as Windows Server’s document servers.
    • Windows Client Computers
  • How do I estimate the quantity of protected instances?

    You can estimate the quantity of protected instances by summing up the following items:

    • Quantity of virtual machines
    • Quantity of computers equipped with DPM proxy (excluding Hyper-V host)
    • Quantity of computers equipped with Azure Backup proxy

    The bill of every protected instance will depend on the “front-end” size of this protected instance.

  • How do I estimate the “front-end” size of protected instances?

    The front-end size of a protected instance refers to the sum (before compression) of all data sizes from the computer to be protected in Azure Backup. Data not protected on the computer will not be included in the size of a protected instance.

    Protected Instances Size of Protected Instances
    Virtual Machines Size of virtual disk requiring backup onto Azure
    Microsoft SQL Server Database and instances requiring backup onto Azure
    Microsoft Document Server Documents and folders to be backed up onto volumes on Azure
    Microsoft SharePoint Total size of SharePoint content field to be protected on Azure
    Microsoft Exchange Size of email on the Exchange Server requiring backup onto Azure
    Microsoft Windows (Client) Documents and folders to be backed up onto volumes on Azure
  • What should I do if my protected instances are very small?

    We provide layers of smaller scale, which are an ideal option for small-scale servers and client computers. If the “front-end” size of the protected instance is less than 50 GB, the instance belongs to the minimum price layer at ¥31.65/month.

  • If I protect the computer on Azure starting in the middle of a month, do I still need to pay the full price of the protected instances?

    No, the expenses are apportioned by usage days of the computer in the current month.

  • If I modify the retention policy of backup data and store more data on Azure, do I need to pay more fees for this part of the protected instances?

    No, this part of the protected instances will not be charged according to the data size (back-end data) stored in Azure. Azure Backup storage data is charged additionally according to the rate of Azure Block Blob storage. The fees of the protected instances are completely charged according to the front-end size, without being affected by different backup and retention policies.

  • Do I need to upgrade my Azure Backup proxy?

    Yes, the new price can be used only after the Azure Backup proxy is upgraded to the latest edition. Use of the proxy of older editions will yield adverse effects on the front-end size of the protected instances to be charged.

Backup Storage Costs

  • Which content is to be charged against me for storage?

    After using the new price, the backup data (also called “back-end size”) stored in Azure will be charged according to the Block Blob rate in the corresponding region.

  • Is Block Blob pricing suitable for LRS or GRS storage?

    This depends on the storage options selected for backup vault. The storage options of backup vault include: local redundant storage (LRS) or offsite redundant storage (GRS).

  • Could I have two different vaults, namely, one using LRS and the other using GRS?

    Yes, this is supported. The backup data in every vault will be charged by the corresponding LRS or GRS Block Blob rate in the region of the vault. The customers have full control over the Azure storage space billing of selected vault options.

  • When should I select LRS storage and when should I obtain GRS storage?

    The Azure Storage Pricing Page provides basic guidance relating to the value of LRS and GRS storage types.

    In a perfect state, the backup data to be used for immediately operable object recovery should be placed on GRS. This ensures that there are always copies of other backup data for time-critical recovery.

    Price-sensitive customers seeking to maintain inexpensive storage (in lieu of local disk) for a long time will find huge value in using LRS.

  • Which factors will affect the backup storage capacity used?

    The total backup data size (back-end size) maintained in Azure Backup for specific protected instances may vary according to the following factors:

    • Retention period of backup data.
    • Net changes stored in every restore point.
    • Compression levels realized for backup data.
    • Frequency of planned backup jobs.
    • Any correlated backup meta.
  • How do I ascertain the backup storage capacity used?

    As with the current pricing, you’re not required to pay for Azure Backup storage transactions. This content is included as a part of the software price you pay.

  • I have a Microsoft SQL Server virtual machine with 250 GB data. How is Azure Backup billed?

    For a SQL Server database of a protected size of 250 GB in Azure Backup, the SQL Server is taken as the protected instance. As the size of the protected instance is bigger than 50 GB but smaller than 500 GB, ¥63.29 is charged. If the virtual machine is also backed up in Azure Backup, it will be counted as another protected instance. As the size of virtual machine is smaller than 500 GB, ¥63.29 is charged.

    Note: the virtual machine backup and workload backup (running in virtual machine) are charged individually

Support and Service Level Agreements

If you have any questions or need any help, please access Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

We guarantee that the availability of the backup and recovery functions of Azure backup service reaches at least 99.9%. The availability is calculated by the monthly billing cycle. To learn more about the details of our server level agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.
